meanings.sent1: The farmer used a pesticidal spray to protect his crops from insects.
meanings.sent2: The company developed a new pesticidal formula to combat weeds effectively.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome joked that his hat was made of pesticidal material to keep bugs away.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as pesticidal as a powerful insecticide, brightening everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays acted like a pesticidal shield, warding off any harmful pests from the garden.

meanings.sent1: The pesticidal powder quickly eliminated the ant infestation in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The strong pesticidal properties of the new product made it highly effective against rodents.
meanings.sent3: The cat proudly displayed its pesticidal skills by catching a mouse in the barn.
meanings.sent4: His words were as pesticidal as a potent insect killer, silencing any doubts in the room.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's powers were described as pesticidal, eradicating evil like pests from the city.

meanings.definition: Having the properties of a pesticide.
meanings.sent1: The pesticidal effect of the solution was evident as the weeds wilted away.
meanings.sent2: The team tested the pesticidal nature of the substance on different types of insects.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed to have pesticidal qualities, making coins disappear like pests.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as pesticidal as a potent bug spray, clearing the room of any doubts.
meanings.sent5: The potion had a pesticidal aroma, repelling insects with its strong scent.
